revision.comment: Created page with "{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Deako |model=DP-BRTM-WHMC-UCX |revision= |fcc_date=05/10/2018 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |type=IoT hub |fcc_id=2AK29DPBRTMWHMCUCX, 2AO..."
revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Deako |model=DP-BRTM-WHMC-UCX |revision= |fcc_date=05/10/2018 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |type=IoT hub |fcc_id=2AK29DPBRTMWHMCUCX, 2AO7I-T1 |pwr_v=100-240 |pwr_amp=0.2 |pwr_conn=AC (direct) |pwr_ac_hz=50/60 |cpu2_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |fla1_brand=GigaDevice |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Winbond |ram1_model=W9751G6KB-25 |wi1_chip1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_none=true |flags=Bluetooth 4.1 LE, Alexa support, |802dot11_protocols=bgn }} {{TagLine|Deako Bluetooth to Wifi Bridge}}
This is a Change of ID Request from some Droplit FCC entry, presumably the [[Droplit Hub T1]] which is identical in appearance and was actually branded as Deako in its external photos. Most details are copied from that product.
"40-KIWIMQ-MAE4G" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
External FCC photos show the device branded as "Remote Access Bridge KIWI MINI Q." but "deako" appears to be photoshopped out unlike in the external photos for the [[Droplit Hub T1]]. It appears to be identical to the [http://avi-on.com/remote-access-bridge/ Avi-on Remote Access Bridge]
